selected_quotes: WW1 spawned a transformation of the way African-Americans imagined themselves, their past and their future #HNN_arts
@karenhunter fascinating article, I'd never heard of McKay. So much history in the shadows, not taught
.@GSU_English Prof. Elizabeth West examines World War I, American culture literature
How #WorldWarI helped spark the Harlem Renaissance
Out of the ashes of World War I, a new black American #literature was born #WWIcentury

citation.abstract: Many associate post-World War I culture with Hemingway and Fitzgerald's Lost Generation. But for black artists, writers and thinkers, the war changed the way they saw their past and their future.
citation.title: How World War I sparked the artistic movement that transformed black America

facebook.title: How World War I sparked the artistic movement that transformed black America
facebook.summary:
World War I's literary heritage: 
'With Africa as a source of inspiration, a “New Negro” emerged out of the ruins of the Great War – not broken and disenchanted, but possessed with a new sense of self, one shaped from bold, unapologetically black models.'
